items.name: XMP / EXPO / DOCP (Profile 1)
items.notes: Use Profile 1 (usually most stable). Profile 2/tweaked can be unstable.

keywords.ASUS: AI Overclock Tuner → XMP I / EXPO I

items.name: DRAM Frequency
items.notes: Verify the selected frequency actually applied after save & reboot.

items.name: Gear Mode / Memory Controller Ratio (Intel DDR4)
items.notes: On some boards called 'Gear Mode'. Gear 1 improves latency but may limit max RAM OC.

keywords.ASUS: Memory Controller DRAM Frequency Ratio / Gear Mode

items.name: Command Rate (CR)
items.notes: 1T can improve latency but may reduce stability.

items.name: tREFI
items.notes: Increasing tREFI can improve performance but can cause memory errors if too high.

items.name: Power Down Enable
items.notes: Disabling can improve latency at idle; may raise idle power slightly.

items.name: Gear Down Mode (AMD)
items.notes: Disabling can reduce latency but can reduce stability; AMD-only.

items.name: Bank Group Swap (DDR4)
items.notes: DDR4 only: can improve latency in some cases; requires stability testing.

items.name: Bank Group Swap Alt (DDR4)
items.notes: DDR4 only; test for stability.

items.name: Memory Data Scramble / TSME
items.notes: Disabling can reduce latency slightly but reduces certain memory security protections.

items.name: Primary timings (tCL/tRCD/tRP/tRAS)
items.notes: Manual timing tuning requires memory stress testing (TM5/Karhu).

items.name: DRAM Voltage (VDD/VDDQ for DDR5)
items.notes: Incorrect voltage can cause instability or degrade memory over time.

items.name: System Agent / IMC voltage (Intel)
items.notes: Only for high RAM OC; can degrade CPU if set too high.

items.name: Memory Context Restore (AMD)
items.notes: If you get memory training issues, disable.

items.name: Power Down Mode (AMD DDR5)
items.notes: Disabling can improve latency; test stability.

items.name: UCLK==MEMCLK (AMD)
items.notes: Improves latency; may limit max frequency.

items.name: Memory Fast Boot / MRC Fast Boot
items.notes: Speeds boot. Disable if memory training issues.

items.name: Memory Training
items.notes: Leave on Auto unless troubleshooting boot loops.

items.name: ECC Support
items.notes: Consumer boards typically ignore this; only relevant for ECC-capable platforms.

items.name: Multi‑Core Enhancement / Remove All Limits (Intel)
items.notes: Increases power/heat. Requires strong cooling.

items.name: Adaptive Boost Technology (Intel)
items.notes: Usually not helpful for gaming latency; may increase heat.

items.name: Thermal Velocity Boost (Intel)
items.notes: Disable for consistency; leaving Auto is fine if temps are excellent.

items.name: Efficiency Cores (Intel 12/13/14th)
items.notes: Disabling can help latency on Win10 but may reduce performance in multitasking; Win11 schedules E-cores better.

items.name: Hyper‑Threading / SMT
items.notes: Disabling can reduce stutters in rare cases but often reduces overall performance.

items.name: CPU C‑States
items.notes: Can reduce latency spikes but increases idle power/temps.

items.name: Intel Speed Shift / HWP
items.notes: May reduce latency on some systems; can reduce efficiency.

items.name: Intel SpeedStep / EIST
items.notes: Disabling can increase consistency but raises idle power.

items.name: Thermal Monitor / PROCHOT
items.notes: Do NOT disable unless you accept overheating risk.

items.name: CPU Power Limits (PL1/PL2/Tau)
items.notes: Raising limits can improve sustained clocks; watch temps and VRM.

items.name: Precision Boost Overdrive (AMD)
items.notes: Light PBO can help FPS; extreme tuning requires stability testing.

items.name: CPU Boost Clock Override (AMD)
items.notes: Only if stable and temps are good.

items.name: CPPC (AMD)
items.notes: Improves core selection for boosting.

items.name: Global C‑State Control (AMD)
items.notes: Can improve consistency; raises idle power/temps.

items.name: Intel Turbo Boost
items.notes: Keep enabled for performance.

items.name: Core Performance Boost (AMD)
items.notes: Keep enabled for performance.

items.name: SMT (AMD)
items.notes: Disabling can help rare games; usually worse overall.

items.name: AMD Precision Boost (CPB)
items.notes: Same as Core Performance Boost.

items.name: Load Line Calibration (CPU)
items.notes: Too aggressive LLC can cause voltage spikes.

items.name: SVID Behavior (Intel)
items.notes: Affects voltage behavior; wrong value can cause instability.

items.name: Current Excursion Protection (Intel)
items.notes: Disabling can increase performance but raises risk.

items.name: SVM Mode (AMD virtualization)
items.notes: Virtualization may be needed for some anti-cheats.

items.name: Fmax Enhancer (AMD, some boards)
items.notes: Often unstable or unnecessary; leave disabled.

items.name: Power Supply Idle Control (AMD)
items.notes: Prevents idle stability issues on some PSUs; can affect latency.

items.name: CPPC Preferred Cores (AMD)
items.notes: Helps OS pick best cores for boosting.

items.name: Intel SGX
items.notes: Usually unnecessary for gaming; disable to reduce attack surface.

items.name: Intel TXT
items.notes: Enterprise feature; can affect boot/compatibility.

items.name: Thunderbolt Support
items.notes: Disable if you don't use Thunderbolt devices.

items.name: C1E
items.notes: Disabling may improve consistency; increases idle power.

items.name: Package C State Limit
items.notes: Limiting package C-states can reduce latency spikes; increases idle power.

items.name: Turbo Mode
items.notes: Keep enabled for performance.

items.name: Cool'n'Quiet (AMD)
items.notes: Disabling may reduce latency; increases idle power.

items.name: C6 State (AMD)
items.notes: Can reduce latency spikes; increases idle power.

items.name: TSC/HPET related (if present)
items.notes: Most boards don't expose this; OS-side tools handle timer settings.

items.name: Above 4G Decoding
items.notes: Required for Resizable BAR on many systems.

items.name: Resizable BAR
items.notes: Only enable if supported by GPU + BIOS.

items.name: ASPM / PCIe Link State Power Management (firmware)
items.notes: Disabling reduces latency spikes.

items.name: PCIe Slot Link Speed
items.notes: Forcing higher can cause instability if signal quality is poor.

items.name: PCIe Spread Spectrum
items.notes: Disabling can improve consistency; in high EMI environments enabling can help.

items.name: IOMMU
items.notes: Required for some virtualization; disabling can reduce overhead slightly.

items.name: SR-IOV Support
items.notes: Only needed for virtualization features.

items.name: ACS Control
items.notes: Virtualization/PCIe isolation setting; leave default unless needed.

items.name: DMI/Chipset ASPM
items.notes: Chipset link power saving can add latency.

items.name: Primary Display
items.notes: Ensures discrete GPU is primary.

items.name: CSM (Compatibility Support Module)
items.notes: CSM can prevent Resizable BAR and Secure Boot.

items.name: PCIe Native Power Management
items.notes: Disabling can reduce latency spikes.

items.name: PCIe L1 Substates
items.notes: Disable for consistency/latency.

items.name: ARI Support
items.notes: Leave default unless needed for virtualization.

items.name: PCIe Hot Plug
items.notes: Disable on desktops unless you need hot-plug.

items.name: NVMe RAID / VMD
items.notes: Disable if you don't use RAID/VMD; can simplify drivers and reduce overhead.

items.name: XHCI Handoff
items.notes: Helps USB compatibility.

items.name: Legacy USB Support
items.notes: If BIOS can’t see keyboard/USB stick, keep Auto/Enabled.

items.name: USB Power Delivery / ErP USB power
items.notes: Disabling reduces standby power and background controllers.

keywords.ASUS: USB power delivery in Soft Off state

items.name: Fast Boot
items.notes: Fast boot can hide USB/boot device options and complicate troubleshooting.

items.name: XHCI Mode
items.notes: Ensure modern USB controller mode is enabled.

items.name: USB selective suspend (firmware)
items.notes: If present in BIOS, disable for input consistency.

items.name: TPM (fTPM/PTT)
items.notes: Some games/anti-cheat require TPM and Secure Boot.

items.name: Secure Boot
items.notes: Required for some anti-cheats; can break older OS installs.

items.name: Virtualization (VT-x / SVM)
items.notes: Some anti-cheats require virtualization; VMs require it too.

items.name: VT-d
items.notes: IOMMU/VTD can be required. Test compatibility.

items.name: Kernel DMA Protection
items.notes: Security feature; disabling not recommended.

items.name: Secure Boot Mode
items.notes: Use Standard unless managing custom keys.

items.name: TPM Device Selection
items.notes: Use firmware TPM unless you have a discrete TPM module.

items.name: fTPM (AMD) microstutter mitigation
items.notes: If you experience stutter, update BIOS/AGESA; do not disable on Win11 if TPM required.

items.name: Integrated Graphics (iGPU)
items.notes: Disable to reduce drivers if you never use it. Keep enabled if you use QuickSync or display out from iGPU.

items.name: Onboard Audio
items.notes: Disabling reduces driver stack if you use an external DAC/headset.

items.name: Wi‑Fi / Bluetooth Controllers
items.notes: Reduces background drivers.

items.name: RGB / Vendor Controllers
items.notes: Avoid vendor bloat utilities.

items.name: Secondary LAN Controller
items.notes: If you have dual LAN and only use one, disable the other.

items.name: SATA Controller
items.notes: Disable only if you have no SATA drives.

items.name: Serial/COM Port
items.notes: Disable legacy devices if present.

items.name: Front Panel HD Audio
items.notes: Disable if you never use front audio.

items.name: Platform PCIe Power Saving (Clock gating, L1 substates)
items.notes: Disable PCIe power saving for consistency/latency.

keywords.ASUS: Platform Misc Configuration → PCIe power saving

items.name: ErP Ready
items.notes: Can affect USB power in shutdown; disable for gaming rigs.

items.name: BCLK Spread Spectrum
items.notes: Disabling can improve clock stability; sometimes enabling helps EMI.

items.name: Global ASPM
items.notes: Disable global PCIe power saving for gaming.

items.name: SATA Aggressive Link Power Management
items.notes: Disable to avoid storage latency spikes.

items.name: PCH Power Saving
items.notes: Disable chipset power saving for consistency.

items.name: CPU Fan Curve
items.notes: Lower temps improve boost behavior; aggressive curves increase noise.

items.name: AIO Pump Speed
items.notes: For AIO, keep pump at 100% unless pump noise is an issue.

items.name: Case Fan Mode
items.notes: Case airflow helps GPU and VRM temps.

items.name: Boot Mode
items.notes: UEFI required for Secure Boot and often for Resizable BAR.

items.name: Network Stack / PXE Boot
items.notes: Disable PXE/network boot for faster boot and less attack surface.

items.name: Fast Boot
items.notes: Fast boot can interfere with entering BIOS or USB detection.

items.name: POST Delay Time
items.notes: Set to 0 to reduce boot time (optional).

items.name: Full Screen Logo
items.notes: Disabling can speed boot slightly and show POST info.
